author: Staff Reporter
text:
Condemning the corporation’s move to increase the rent and lease amount for shops located in its commercial complex, shopkeepers downed their shutters here on Monday.

The shops at the corporation-owned commercial complexes in New Bus Stand and Old Bus Stand are either given for rent or on lease basis. Recently, it has hiked the rent and also the lease amount charges and passed resolution. Traders said that it is the only corporation in the country that had hiked the charges many fold times which is unreasonable. They said that the hike would affect the traders and shop keepers. “We did not get jobs or have money for investments. We borrowed money and run these shops”, they added.

Shopkeepers said the hike would leave them to spent major portion of their earnings for rent and bear only loss in business. “It is injustice to raise the charges that we cannot pay or bear”, they added. They said that 1,500 families are directly benefitted by the shops. They later submitted a petition to the Mayor S. Soundappan.
title: Traders down shutters
